text:
• You started saying I bugged your phone because of how quickly I replied to you on OFW. This was actually my watch vibrating when you sent me
something.
• You started saying I was tracking your car because somehow I was catching you lying. You misrepresent the truth so often (Boxing Day), your "tells"
are obvious.
• You maintained the ability to track my car and where I was coming and going in real time. You have assured me you deleted the app and don't use it
anymore.
• Then we had the cam incident that gave you another reason to say I was spying on you. I apologize for not being more forthcoming and explaining
this in detail.
• You were super pissed I asked for a mutual "no digital surveillance" agreement. Your response was you would initiate career-ending litigation if I
asked for this.
• You changed the Kirkland Xfinity plan to eliminate my access. As the network admin, you send me daily alerts and below you somehow say "stop
tracking me".
• I began noting the situation mentioned above to you along with screen captures. I explained the tech and told you how we can stop it but you have
made no effort.
• You said I was tracking you since we have a Microsoft family plan. The data on the shared plan has never changed, and you know this because you
paid that bill.
• After hearing about the cam situation in painstaking detail and a series of meetings, Dr. Brown said we both have good points; it's time to move
ahead w/o retribution.
At present, in addition to the things mentioned above, you can still control the sleep number of my bed and I can control the temperature of the
Kirkland house (which you ask me to help with.) After telling you we have a bunch of things that a smart, digitally connected, and cost-conscious
family would implement to keep the kids safe, discourage intruders, and save money, here we are. My apology for not "re-notifying" you of offline
cams used for visual deterrence resulted in not being able to see my kids and likely irreparable parental alienation. My request for you to share "mutual
digital monitoring protocols" resulted in threats against my livelihood, promised legal retribution, and a false restraining order that says I am a
"credible threat to do you and my kids physical harm" stands to this day. Despite confirming that the RO was both a mistake to file and false, you
refuse to remedy the situation.
You always criticize me when I spend the time and effort to explain things to you in detail and recount our history. You say it is too much for you to
understand and it makes you mad that you have to spend time reading it and have to come back later. So yes, it did take 30 minutes to write this all
down. But I think it is important to separate fact from fiction, and given the toll it has taken, if you have made it this far,  it might also be worth you
taking ten minutes to read and contemplate we really don't have to keep going down this road. I genuinely want what's best for our kids, and
honestly, I want what's best for you – for the sake of our safety and peace of mind. If you're open to looking at things differently, I'm more than ready
to work together in a positive way.
• robert
